question: Refer to the figure <image 1>, which term refers to an illustration facing the title page that is intended to establish the tone and entice the reader to begin the story?
description: The image shows an open book with two pages visible. On the left page, there is a colorful illustration depicting a young girl carrying another child in her arms while running through a grassy field. In the background, there is a cow grazing. The illustration is vibrant and detailed, capturing a lively scene. On the right page, there is text that reads "JUST PEGGY" by Margaret Snarr Lane, illustrated by M.D. Johnston. Below the title, there is a smaller black-and-white illustration showing a child sitting on a tree stump, reading a book. The text also includes the publisher's information: "London Humphrey Milford Oxford University Press." The left page with the colorful illustration is directly opposite the title page, serving as an introductory visual element for the book. This type of illustration, placed facing the title page, is known as a frontispiece.
